name: Standard 1
title: Students will use mathematical analysis, scientific inquiry, and engineering design, as appropriate, to pose questions, seek answers, and develop solutions.

name: Standard 2
title: Students will access, generate, process, and transfer information using appropriate technologies.

name: Standard 3
title: Students will understand mathematics and become mathematically confident by communicating and reasoning mathematically, by applying mathematics in real-world settings, and by solving problems through the integrated study of number systems, geometry, algebra, data analysis, probability, and trigonometry.

name: Standard 4
title: Students will understand and apply scientific concepts, principles, and theories pertaining to the physical setting and living environment and recognize the historical development of ideas in science

name: Standard 5
title: Students will apply technological knowledge and skills to design, construct, use, and evaluate products and systems to satisfy human and environmental needs.

name: Standard 6
title: Students will understand the relationships and common themes that connect mathematics, science, and technology and apply the themes to these and other areas of learning.

name: Standard 7
title: Students will apply the knowledge and thinking skills of mathematics, science, and technology to address real-life problems and make informed decisions.
